question: Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct?
options: Me and my friends went to the movies.
My friends and me went to the movies.
My friends and I went to the movies.
I and my friends went to the movies.

question: Which of the following sentences uses the correct verb tense?
options: I eat breakfast at 7am every morning.
I ate breakfast at 7am every morning.
I will eat breakfast at 7am every morning.
I am eat breakfast at 7am every morning.

question: Which of the following sentences is written in the active voice?
options: The cake was eaten by the dog.
The cake has been eaten by the dog.
The cake is eaten by the dog.

question: Which of the following sentences is a run-on sentence?
options: I like to eat pizza, but I also like to eat burgers.
I like to eat pizza. I also like to eat burgers.
I like to eat pizza, I also like to eat burgers.
I like to eat pizza and I also like to eat burgers.

question: Which of the following sentences uses correct subject-verb agreement?
Which of the following sentences uses correct punctuation?
options: My favorite colors are red, green, and blue.
My favorite colors are red, green and blue.
My favorite colors are red green and blue.
My favorite colors are red,green, and blue.

question: Which of the following sentences uses correct capitalization?
options: jane lives in new york city.
Jane lives in New York City.
jane lives in New York City.
Jane lives in new york city.

question: Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct?
options: He don't like to eat vegetables.
He doesn't like to eat vegetables.
He didn't like to eat vegetables.
He isn't like to eat vegetables.

question: Which of the following sentences uses the correct pronoun?
options: John and me went to the store.
John and I went to the store.
Me and John went to the store.
I and John went to the store.

question: 「傲慢な、横柄な」という意味を持つ英単語は？
「抑圧する、押さえつける」という意味を持つ英単語は？
「細心の注意を払って、注意深く」という意味を持つ英単語は？
「根絶する、完全に取り除く」という意味を持つ英単語は？
「慈悲深い、情け深い」という意味を持つ英単語は？
